title: [P0] Tree2mydoor PMAX Asset Optimiser - Complete URL-Based Review Sheet Upload
notes:
⚠️ CRITICAL DECISION NEEDED: Two versions exist - OLD (92 assets) vs NEW (154 assets with URL-based product matching)

## Current Status

✅ COMPLETED TODAY:
- Reformatted review sheet to Devonshire format (1 row per asset, 3 options side-by-side)
- Added Campaign and Asset Group columns
- Fixed product mismatch problem (lemon trees appearing in olive tree groups)
- Implemented URL-based product context extraction
- Optimised generation: 154 → 23 batched AI calls (6x faster)
- Google Sheet uploaded: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1XYW4jVS785qnj2gFauPc4uJSnpOZOJck0OLo4nFZNTI/edit

⚠️ ISSUE: Current Google Sheet contains OLD data (92 assets, NO URL-based generation)
✅ SOLUTION AVAILABLE: NEW data exists (154 assets WITH URL-based product matching)

## Decision Required

Use NEW URL-based replacements (RECOMMENDED):
- 154 underperformers (vs 92 in OLD)
- Product-specific text matching from landing page URLs
- Fixes lemon/olive tree mismatch issues
- Need to regenerate review sheet and re-upload

Commands to use NEW data:
```bash
cd /Users/administrator/Documents/PetesBrain/roksys/tools/pmax-asset-optimiser
python3 create_review_sheet.py
python3 automated_sheets_upload.py
```

## Technical Details

URL-Based Product Extraction:
- /collections/olive-trees → "olive trees (Mediterranean olive varieties)"
- /collections/lemon-trees → "lemon trees (citrus trees for patios)"
- /collections/memorial-rose-bushes → "rose bushes (memorial and sympathy roses)"

Files Modified:
- fetch_asset_performance_api.py: Added asset_group.final_urls to GAQL
- analyse_asset_performance.py: Pass through Asset Group URL
- generate_replacement_text.py: Lines 90-101 (bypass website analysis), Lines 453-503 (_extract_product_from_url), Lines 570-629 (batching)

## Output Files

output/asset-performance-4941701449-2025-11-26.csv (560 assets with URLs)
output/underperforming-assets.csv (154 underperformers with URLs)
output/replacement-candidates.csv (462 URL-based alternatives)
output/tree2mydoor-review-sheet.csv (Devonshire format)

## Next Steps After Review Sheet Confirmed

1. User reviews Google Sheet
2. Select option 1/2/3 or leave blank in "Selected Option" column
3. Download as CSV: output/tree2mydoor-reviewed-selections.csv
4. Execute: python3 execute_asset_optimisation.py

## Customer ID
Tree2mydoor: 4941701449

title: [NMA] Week 3.2: Expand ROW Engineering keyword portfolio (2 hours)
notes:
ROW Engineering is best performer (£34,744 CPA vs £169k avg). Add 15-20 related keywords.

Suggestions: automotive engineering courses, motorsport engineering online, automotive technology degree, vehicle engineering programs, racing engineering courses, automotive design degree, motorsport management degree.

Match type: 70% Broad, 30% Exact. Consider budget increase to £80/day if Nov 29 review shows strong performance.

Expected: +10-15 conversions/month

title: [NMA] Week 3.1: Add callout extensions (1 hour)
notes:
Add 40+ callouts across active campaigns (shared set).

Categories:
- Program Benefits: Industry Partnerships, Practical Experience, Career Support
- Study Flexibility: Online & On-Campus Options, Flexible Payment, Study While You Work
- Credibility: Accredited Programs, Expert Tutors, Award-Winning
- Outcomes: 95% Employment Rate, Global Alumni Network

Expected: +5-8% CTR improvement

title: [NMA] Week 2.6: Compare US/UAE vs ROW Management performance (30 mins)
notes:
After 2 weeks of country campaigns running alongside ROW Management, compare performance:

US campaign: Conversions, CPA, CTR vs ROW Management
UAE campaign: Conversions, CPA, CTR vs ROW Management

Decision: If country campaigns prove superior, gradually shift budget from ROW Management. Do NOT pause immediately - gradual migration.

title: [NMA] Remove zero-impression keywords (30 mins)
notes:
Pause ~150 keywords identified in Week 1 review.

Focus on keywords with QS <3 and 0 impressions in 90 days.

Expected impact: Cleaner account structure, improved account-level quality score, easier monitoring.

title: [NMA] Create UAE country-specific campaign (2 hours)
notes:
Campaign: NMA | Search | UAE | Engineering
- Daily Budget: £20
- Target CPA: £40
- Keywords: Middle East engineering education terms
- Ad copy: UAE partnerships, regional relevance
- Sitelinks: International student support

Expected: 1-2 conversions in first month. Run alongside ROW Management for 2 weeks.

title: [NMA] Create US country-specific campaign (2 hours)
notes:
Campaign: NMA | Search | US | Engineering
- Daily Budget: £30
- Target CPA: £60
- Keywords: US-focused engineering terms
- Ad copy: US career outcomes, accreditation
- Sitelinks: US application process, alumni in US

Expected: 2-4 conversions in first month. Run alongside ROW Management for 2 weeks, compare performance.

title: [NMA] Apply demographic bid adjustments (30 mins)
notes:
Based on Week 1 demographic analysis.

Conservative approach: Apply -20% bid adjustment (NOT exclusions) to segments with CPA >2x average.

Likely segments: 18-24, possibly 65+.

Test for 2 weeks before further adjustments. Maintains reach while optimizing.

title: [NMA] Review Target CPA performance (1 hour) - CRITICAL
notes:
3-week review of Target CPA (implemented Nov 10).

Compare CPAs to targets:
- UK Search: Target £100
- ROW Search: Target £50  
- UK Management: Target £150

If within 20% of target: continue. If 20-50% above: reduce budget 10-15%. If 50%+ above: review structure.

Decide on budget adjustments (e.g., ROW Engineering £40→£80/day if performing well).

title: Decide: Resubscribe to Cursor Pro?

title: Spec out text asset creation → Google Ads API posting workflow
notes:
**Goal**: Document a streamlined process for creating text assets (headlines, descriptions, sitelinks, callouts) and posting them directly to Google Ads campaigns/asset groups via API.

**Existing Components to Gather**:
- MCP Google Ads tools:
  * mcp__google-ads__create_responsive_search_ad (RSAs with headlines/descriptions)
  * mcp__google-ads__create_asset_group (PMax asset groups - text only)
  * mcp__google-ads__add_sitelinks (sitelink extensions)
  * mcp__google-ads__add_callouts (callout extensions)
  * mcp__google-ads__create_campaign
  * mcp__google-ads__create_ad_group
- Skills:
  * google-ads-text-generator skill (generates copy with ROK specs)
- Documentation:
  * MCP-SERVERS.md (tool parameters and examples)
  * Google Ads copy standards (sentence case, capitalization rules)

**Deliverable**: Spec document outlining:
1. Current capabilities (what's already built)
2. Workflow options (skill → MCP tools, or integrated process)
3. Missing pieces (if any)
4. Recommended approach for fastest asset creation → posting
5. Example end-to-end flow

**Output**: Save to roksys/documents/google-ads-text-asset-posting-workflow.md

**Priority**: Medium - only if time available tomorrow

title: Godshot: Fix WooCommerce API 403 Forbidden error
notes:
WooCommerce REST API returning 403 Forbidden when trying to access order data. This blocks revenue reconciliation and product ID mapping.

ISSUE:
- API credentials in .mcp.json: ck_d1906a0a64cdc4f9b365d67c6757c0b603335402
- All endpoints returning 403 Forbidden via nginx
- Cannot verify actual sales vs Google Ads conversions

POSSIBLE CAUSES:
1. IP address not whitelisted (nginx blocking)
2. API keys expired or permissions changed
3. WooCommerce REST API disabled
4. Security plugin blocking requests
5. Rate limiting or firewall rules

ACTION REQUIRED:
1. Check if API keys still valid in WooCommerce > Settings > Advanced > REST API
2. Verify REST API is enabled
3. Check for security plugins (Wordfence, iThemes, etc) blocking API access
4. Review nginx/server firewall rules
5. Test API access from different IP if needed
6. Regenerate API keys if necessary and update .mcp.json

CRITICAL: Need working API access for conversion tracking audit and weekly reconciliation process documented in CONTEXT.md

title: Smythson: Final Q4 Assessment & Learnings Documentation
notes:
📊 **Q4 STRATEGY FINAL ASSESSMENT**

**What this is:**
- **COMPLETE Q4 POST-MORTEM** - Oct 29 to Dec 31 (9 weeks)
- Final results vs targets
- What worked, what didn't
- Learnings for Q1 2026 and Strategy Playbook
- Celebrate wins, document failures

**Q4 Targets (Reminder):**
- Total Revenue: £780,691
- Total Spend: ≤£367,014
- Overall profitable (ROAS varies by region)
- All milestones evaluated with data

---

**CONVERSATION TO HAVE WITH CLAUDE:**

**Step 1 - Pull complete Q4 final results:**
```
"Run final Smythson Q4 assessment - complete Oct 29 to Dec 31 results"
```

**Claude will show you:**
- Total Q4 revenue (all regions)
- Total Q4 spend
- Overall ROAS
- vs Targets: Revenue (£780K), Spend (£367K)
- Regional breakdown (UK, USA, EUR, ROW contributions)

**Step 2 - Evaluate each milestone:**
```
"Review all Q4 milestones - which changes worked and which didn't?"
```

**Claude will analyze:**

**Phase 1 (Oct 29 - Nov 1): Launches**
- UK campaign: Performance vs baseline target
- EUR campaign: Performance vs baseline target
- USA campaign: Performance vs baseline target

**Phase 2 (Nov 15): Mid-November Adjustments**
- UK ROAS reduction (4.3→3.8): Success/failure vs hypothesis
- ROW launch: Profitable or not?

**Phase 3 (Nov 25): Thanksgiving**
- USA Thanksgiving boost: ROI vs cost
- Revenue spike vs normal weeks

**Phase 4 (Dec 1): December Push**
- UK ROAS reduction (3.8→3.5): Did it drive volume?
- USA ROAS reduction (2.2→2.0): Profitable scaling?
- EUR/ROW budget adjustments: Right decisions?

**Phase 5 (Dec 15-31): Final Push**
- Did final 2-week strategy work?
- Any emergency changes made?

**Step 3 - Extract key learnings:**
```
"What are the top 5 learnings from Smythson Q4 strategy?"
```

**Claude will identify:**
- What worked best (proven wins to replicate)
- What didn't work (avoid in future)
- Surprises (unexpected results)
- Regional differences (UK vs USA vs EUR vs ROW)
- Timing insights (when to make changes)

**Step 4 - Strategy Playbook documentation:**
```
"Add Smythson Q4 learnings to Strategy Playbook"
```

**Claude will:**
- Update `roksys/knowledge-base/rok-methodologies/strategy-playbook.md`
- Add proven wins (if applicable):
  * Phased ROAS reductions
  * Regional budget optimization
  * Holiday budget boosts (Thanksgiving)
- Add failed tests (if applicable):
  * Strategies that didn't work
  * Regional approaches to avoid
- Update pattern library with Q4 insights

**Step 5 - Q1 2026 recommendations:**
```
"Based on Q4 results, what should I do differently for Smythson in Q1 2026?"
```

**Claude will provide:**
- Budget allocation recommendations
- ROAS target suggestions by region
- Campaign structure optimizations
- Timing for strategic changes
- Regional focus (double down on winners)

**Step 6 - Final tracker update:**
```
"Complete the Q4 strategy tracker with all final results and assessment"
```

**Claude will:**
- Fill in Milestone 5.2 (Final Q4 Performance Assessment)
- Complete all "Actual Results" fields
- Fill in all "Impact Assessment" sections
- Finalize cumulative performance table
- Add comprehensive "Key Learnings" section
- Add "Rollout Recommendations" for other clients

---

**WHY THIS MATTERS:**
- **Close the loop** - Every experiment evaluated
- **Institutional knowledge** - Document everything learned
- **Scale successes** - Identify patterns for other clients
- **Avoid repeating failures** - Clear documentation of what didn't work
- **Q1 2026 strategy** - Use data to inform next quarter

**KEY QUESTIONS TO ANSWER:**

1. **Did we hit £780,691 target?** (Yes/No + final number)
2. **Did we stay within £367,014 budget?** (Yes/No + final spend)
3. **Was Q4 profitable overall?** (Overall ROAS, margin)
4. **Which region performed best?** (UK/USA/EUR/ROW)
5. **Which region underperformed?** (Lessons learned)
6. **Did phased ROAS reductions work?** (Validate hypothesis)
7. **Should we roll out this approach to other clients?** (Yes/No + which ones)
8. **Top 3 wins to celebrate?**
9. **Top 3 failures to avoid repeating?**
10. **What would we do differently next time?**

---

**DELIVERABLES FROM THIS REVIEW:**

1. **Completed Q4 Strategy Tracker** (all fields filled)
2. **Updated Strategy Playbook** (proven wins + failed tests)
3. **Smythson CONTEXT.md updated** (Q4 results + learnings)
4. **Q1 2026 Strategy Recommendations** (data-driven next steps)
5. **Optional: Client report** (if presenting Q4 results to Smythson)

---

**NEXT STEPS AFTER THIS REVIEW:**

1. **Share learnings with team** (if applicable)
2. **Plan Q1 2026 strategy** (based on Q4 data)
3. **Identify rollout candidates** (other clients for proven patterns)
4. **Create Q1 milestones** (if continuing structured approach)
5. **Archive Q4 documentation** (keep for future reference)

---

**TIME REQUIRED:** 60-90 minutes (comprehensive final assessment)

**CELEBRATION TIME:** If you hit or exceeded targets, take a moment to appreciate the structured, data-driven approach that got you there! 🎉

---

**DOCUMENTS:**
- Q4 Strategy Tracker: clients/smythson/documents/q4-2025-strategy-tracker.md (FINAL VERSION)
- Strategy Playbook: roksys/knowledge-base/rok-methodologies/strategy-playbook.md (UPDATED)
- Smythson CONTEXT.md: clients/smythson/CONTEXT.md (Q4 RESULTS ADDED)
- Q4 Strategy Report: clients/smythson/documents/q4-2025-strategy-report-final.html (ORIGINAL PLAN)

title: Smythson: Revenue Target Validation - Mid-December Check
notes:
📊 **Q4 STRATEGY MILESTONE REVIEW**

**What this is:**
- **CRITICAL CHECKPOINT** - Will we hit £780,691 revenue target?
- 6.5 weeks of Q4 complete (Oct 29 - Dec 15)
- 2.5 weeks remaining to year-end
- Projection and final course correction opportunity

**Context:**
- Total Q4 Budget: £367,014
- Target Revenue: £780,691
- Overall Target ROAS: Variable by region
- Time elapsed: ~72% of Q4
- Expected revenue to date: ~£560K (72% of £780K)

---

**CONVERSATION TO HAVE WITH CLAUDE:**

**Step 1 - Pull complete Q4 performance to date:**
```
"Run Smythson Q4 revenue validation - Oct 29 to Dec 15"
```

**Claude will show you:**
- Total Q4 revenue to date (all regions combined)
- Total Q4 spend to date
- Overall ROAS to date
- % of £780K target achieved
- % of £367K budget used

**Step 2 - Get projection to year-end:**
```
"Based on current pace, will we hit the £780,691 target by Dec 31?"
```

**Claude will:**
- Calculate daily/weekly revenue run rate
- Project final Q4 revenue (based on current pace)
- Show gap to target (positive or negative)
- Calculate probability of hitting target

**Step 3 - Regional performance breakdown:**
```
"Which regions are overperforming and underperforming vs expectations?"
```

**Claude will:**
- UK: Revenue, ROAS, vs target contribution
- USA: Revenue, ROAS, vs target contribution
- EUR: Revenue, ROAS, vs target contribution
- ROW: Revenue, ROAS, vs target contribution
- Identify winners and laggards

**Step 4 - Get final 2-week recommendations:**
```
"What changes should I make in the final 2 weeks to maximize Q4 revenue?"
```

**Claude will provide:**
- If AHEAD of target: Maintain course or optimize profitability?
- If ON TARGET: Stay the course, no changes
- If BEHIND target: Emergency optimizations:
  * Increase budgets in best-performing regions
  * Pause/reduce underperforming regions
  * Final ROAS adjustments
  * Push harder on winners

**Step 5 - Update tracker:**
```
"Update Q4 tracker with Dec 15 validation and final 2-week plan"
```

**Claude will:**
- Fill in Milestone 5.1 (Revenue Target Validation)
- Update cumulative performance table
- Document final 2-week strategy
- Set expectations for Dec 31 final assessment

---

**WHY THIS MATTERS:**
- **Last chance to course-correct** before Q4 ends
- Determine if £780K target is achievable
- Identify if emergency optimizations needed
- Prepare for final 2-week push or controlled finish

**POSSIBLE SCENARIOS:**

**Scenario 1: AHEAD of Target** (>78% to target by Dec 15)
- ✅ On track to exceed £780K
- Options: Maintain course, optimize for profitability, or push even harder
- Focus: Protect gains, don't overspend budget

**Scenario 2: ON Target** (72-78% to target)
- ✅ Pacing well, likely to hit target
- Options: Stay the course, minor tweaks only
- Focus: Steady execution through year-end

**Scenario 3: SLIGHTLY Behind** (65-72% to target)
- ⚠️ Behind pace but catchable
- Options: Moderate budget increases, optimize mix
- Focus: 2-week push to close gap

**Scenario 4: SIGNIFICANTLY Behind** (<65% to target)
- ❌ Unlikely to hit target without major changes
- Options: Emergency budget increases, pause laggards, all-in on winners
- Decision: Go all-in for target or accept shortfall and optimize ROAS?

---

**KEY QUESTIONS TO ANSWER:**

1. **Will we hit £780,691?** (Yes / Likely / Maybe / Unlikely)
2. **Revenue gap to target?** (£X,XXX over/under)
3. **Budget remaining?** (£X,XXX of £367K left)
4. **Best performing region?** (Reallocate budget here?)
5. **Worst performing region?** (Pause or reduce?)
6. **Final 2-week strategy?** (Aggressive push / Maintain / Optimize profitability)

---

**NEXT MILESTONE:** Dec 31 (Final Q4 Assessment - how did we do?)

**TIME REQUIRED:** 45-60 minutes (comprehensive analysis and decision-making)

---

**DOCUMENTS:**
- Q4 Strategy Tracker: clients/smythson/documents/q4-2025-strategy-tracker.md
- Monitoring Workflow: clients/smythson/documents/q4-strategy-monitoring-workflow.md
- Q4 Strategy Report: clients/smythson/documents/q4-2025-strategy-report-final.html

title: Smythson: Review All December Changes (Pre-Implementation)
notes:
📊 **Q4 STRATEGY MILESTONE REVIEW**

**What this is:**
- BEFORE implementing Dec 1 changes, review all November performance
- Go/no-go decision for December ROAS reductions and budget adjustments
- Assess whether to proceed as planned or modify the strategy

**November changes to review:**
- Nov 15: UK ROAS reduction (4.3 → 3.8)
- Nov 15: ROW campaign launch (£354/day)
- Nov 25: USA Thanksgiving boost ($2,604/day, ROAS reduction)

**December changes proposed:**
- UK: ROAS 3.8 → 3.5, budget maintain/adjust
- USA: ROAS 2.2 → 2.0, budget $2,131/day
- EUR: Budget €868 → €817/day, ROAS 1.5 → 1.2
- ROW: Budget £354 → £333/day, ROAS 1.0 → 0.9

---

**CONVERSATION TO HAVE WITH CLAUDE:**

**Step 1 - Review complete November performance:**
```
"Run Smythson November performance review - all regions"
```

**Claude will show you:**
- UK: Oct 29 - Nov 30 performance (full 5 weeks)
- USA: Nov 1 - Nov 30 performance (4 weeks)
- EUR: Oct 29 - Nov 30 performance (5 weeks)
- ROW: Nov 15 - Nov 30 performance (2 weeks)
- Overall Q4 progress vs £780K target

**Step 2 - Assess each November change:**
```
"Did November changes (UK ROAS drop, ROW launch, USA Thanksgiving) work as expected?"
```

**Claude will:**
- UK ROAS reduction: Success/failure vs hypothesis
- ROW launch: Break-even or profitable?
- USA Thanksgiving: Worth the budget increase?
- Overall November assessment

**Step 3 - Get December recommendations:**
```
"Based on November results, should I proceed with all planned December changes?"
```

**Claude will provide:**
- UK: Proceed with 3.8→3.5 or hold? (depends on Nov 15 results)
- USA: Proceed with 2.2→2.0 or adjust? (depends on Thanksgiving)
- EUR: Safe to reduce budget €868→€817? (depends on performance)
- ROW: Continue or pause? (depends on Nov 15-30 results)

**Step 4 - Update tracker and make decisions:**
```
"Update Q4 tracker with complete November results and December go/no-go decisions"
```

**Claude will:**
- Fill in all November milestones with actual results
- Update cumulative performance table (budget pacing, revenue progress)
- Document your decisions for December changes
- Highlight any course corrections needed

---

**WHY THIS MATTERS:**
- **Critical decision point** - Don't blindly implement December changes
- November results determine December strategy
- If November underperformed, December ROAS cuts might be too aggressive
- If November exceeded expectations, might push even harder
- Budget reallocation based on regional performance

**DECISION FRAMEWORK:**

**Proceed with December changes IF:**
- ✅ November changes met expectations
- ✅ On track for £780K Q4 target (or close)
- ✅ No major red flags in any region
- ✅ Budget pacing healthy (not overspending)

**Adjust December changes IF:**
- ⚠️ November mixed results (some worked, some didn't)
- ⚠️ Behind on revenue target but still achievable
- ⚠️ One region underperforming (reallocate budget)

**Pause/revert IF:**
- ❌ November changes failed to meet expectations
- ❌ Significantly behind revenue target
- ❌ Budget overspend concerns
- ❌ ROAS drops too severe

---

**NEXT MILESTONE:** Dec 15 (Revenue target validation - are we on track for £780K?)

**TIME REQUIRED:** 30-45 minutes (comprehensive review)

---

**DOCUMENTS:**
- Q4 Strategy Tracker: clients/smythson/documents/q4-2025-strategy-tracker.md
- Monitoring Workflow: clients/smythson/documents/q4-strategy-monitoring-workflow.md
- Q4 Strategy Report: clients/smythson/documents/q4-2025-strategy-report-final.html

title: [Tree2mydoor] Re-analyse ROAS experiment with full conversion lag (Dec 3-4)
notes:
**FOLLOW-UP ANALYSIS REQUIRED**

Initial analysis completed Dec 1 was premature - need to wait for conversion lag.

**Correct Analysis Periods:**
- Baseline: Nov 17-23 (7 days at 140-150% ROAS)
- Experiment: Nov 24-30 (7 days at 120% ROAS) ← Excludes Dec 1 (reverted)
- Wait until: Dec 3-4 to capture Nov 30 conversion lag

**Why Re-analysis Needed:**
1. Dec 1 was first day AFTER revert to 140-150% (not part of experiment)
2. Nov 30 conversions need 1-3 days to fully attribute
3. Current analysis shows 77% ROAS but may improve to 82-87% with lag

**Action on Dec 3-4:**
1. Query Nov 24-30 performance (7 days, excluding Dec 1)
2. Compare to baseline Nov 17-23 (7 days)
3. Update analysis document with final results

**Preliminary Findings (Dec 1):**
- Experiment ROAS: 77% (may improve to 82-87% with lag)
- Baseline ROAS: 115%
- Net: Still ~28-33pp worse even with lag adjustment
- P Max HP&P collapsed Nov 30 (10% impr share, 18% ROAS)

**File:** /Users/administrator/Documents/PetesBrain/clients/tree2mydoor/documents/black-friday-roas-experiment-analysis.md
